title: Aveo says Brookfield FIRB decision imminent
text:
Aveo suitor Brookfield expects a Foreign Investment Review Board decision on its $1.3 billion takeover bid for the retirement living operator before shareholders are due to vote on the deal early next month.

In a letter to shareholders that accompanied the formal scheme of arrangement on Monday, Aveo said Canada-based Brookfield, which will also take over the company's $752 million debt financing facilities, expected a FIRB decision on the planned takeover by the statutory deadline of October 31 "or shortly thereafter", but ahead of the planned November 6 scheme meeting to approve the deal.

Aveo also said Malaysian investor Mulpha International, which owns almost a quarter of the Australian company, had told its home stock exchange that it intended to vote in favour of the deal.

In addition, the company said sufficient shareholders had opted to receive scrip – or shares – in the new entity, rather than take cash. Under terms of the deal, more than 10 per cent of shareholders were required to elect for the scrip option.

Holders of 100 million worth of Aveo securities had opted to take scrip and none would be subject to a scaleback arrangement as the total did not exceed the 160.6 million available for scrip consideration – about 30 per cent of all shares in issue – the company said.
description: Takeover  target also says sufficient security holders have opted to take scrip, rather than cash.
